page.description: Returns words, stripping out all whitespace.
page.syntax: Output_String as C = WORDS(C character[,N word_number[,N count[,L keyword[,C separator]]]])

argument.name: word_number
argument.description: An integer that specifies which word to return, counting left to right. Numeric

argument.name: count
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1. The number of words to return. Zero (0) returns all words. Numeric

argument.name: keyword
argument.description: Optional. Default = .T. (TRUE). Specifies that Alpha Anywhere should use the same rules for delimiting words that the KEYWORD() function uses. Logical

argument.name: separator
argument.description: Optional. Default = space (" "). Specifies the word separator . If Separator is specified, the Keyword argument is ignored. Separator is particularly useful with CR-LF delimited lists, in which case separator is "crlf() ".

page.discussion: Returns count of words from character, starting with the word identified by word_number.

section.title: Example
section.description: Assume that "fruits" is a CR-LF delimited list with these values:
section.example:
Apple Orange Pear Banana Plum
words(fruits, 3, 2, .T., crlf() ) -> Pear Banana words(fruits, 2, 2, .T.) -> "Orange Pear"
